title: Population estimates comparison
text: First, compare total population estimates, using brpop functions aggregate estimates per UF.  can observed estimates DataSUS UFRN generally agrees tendency present overlapping period (2010 - 2021) similar values. IBGE population estimates present erratic pattern UFs.
code: datasus_pop_uf <- uf_pop_totals(source = "datasus") |>   mutate(source = "DataSUS") |>   filter(uf != "5e") #> Setting `max_tries = 2`. #> Setting `max_tries = 2`. ufrn_pop_uf <- uf_pop_totals(source = "ufrn") |>   mutate(source = "UFRN") #> Setting `max_tries = 2`. #> Setting `max_tries = 2`. ibge_pop_uf <- uf_pop_totals(source = "ibge") |>   mutate(source = "IBGE") #> Setting `max_tries = 2`.  bind_rows(datasus_pop_uf, ufrn_pop_uf, ibge_pop_uf) |>   left_join(names_helper, by = c("uf" = "uf_code")) |>   ggplot(aes(x = year, y = pop, color = source, group = source)) +   geom_line(stat = "identity", alpha = .7, lwd = 1) +   geom_vline(xintercept = c(2000, 2010, 2022), alpha = .5, linetype = "longdash") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = unit_format(accuracy = 1, scale = 0.00001, unit = NULL)) +    facet_wrap(~uf_name, scales = "free_y", ncol = 3) +   theme_bw() +    theme(legend.position = "bottom", legend.direction = "horizontal") +   labs(title = "Population estimates per UF from different sources",        subtitle = "in 100,000 units",        color = "Source", x = "Year", y = "Population estimate")

title: Population estimates comparison
text: Now let’s look capitals data.  municipal level, population estimates capitals presents variability. capitals, estimates DataSUS UFRN converge overlapping period. IBGE estimates also present erratic pattern capitals.
code: datasus_pop_mun <- mun_pop_totals(source = "datasus") |>   mutate(source = "DataSUS") |>   right_join(names_helper, by = c("code_muni" = "cap_code6"))  ufrn_pop_mun <- mun_pop_totals(source = "ufrn") |>   mutate(source = "UFRN") |>   right_join(names_helper, by = c("code_muni" = "cap_code7"))  ibge_pop_mun <- mun_pop_totals(source = "ibge") |>   mutate(source = "IBGE") |>   right_join(names_helper, by = c("code_muni" = "cap_code7"))   bind_rows(datasus_pop_mun, ufrn_pop_mun, ibge_pop_mun) |>   ggplot(aes(x = year, y = pop, color = source, group = source)) +   geom_line(stat = "identity", alpha = .7, lwd = 1) +   geom_vline(xintercept = c(2000, 2010, 2022), alpha = .5, linetype = "longdash") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = unit_format(accuracy = 1, scale = 0.00001, unit = NULL)) +    facet_wrap(~cap_name, scales = "free_y", ncol = 3) +   theme_bw() +    theme(legend.position = "bottom", legend.direction = "horizontal") +   labs(title = "Population estimates per capital from different sources",        subtitle = "in 100,000 units",        color = "Source", x = "Year", y = "Population estimate")

title: Brazilian Population Estimatives
text: brpop R package provides yearly Brazilian population estimates, aggregated state, municipality, sex, age groups. estimates especially useful calculating age sex standardized disease rates.

title: Brazilian Population Estimatives
text: Stable release CRAN. Development version GitHub.

title: Brazilian Population Estimatives
text: package provides population estimates sex, age groups, municipalities year two sources: DataSUS estimates, covering 2000 2021 UFRN-PPGDEM-LEPP estimates, covering 2010 2030. package also provide total population estimates municipality year IBGE 2000 2024. Along datasets, package provide several functions aggregate estimates state (UF) health regions. Look Reference section details.

title: brpop: Brazilian Population Estimatives — brpop-package
text: Functions handle aggregate population estimates Brazilian municipalities sex age groups.

title: brpop: Brazilian Population Estimatives — brpop-package
text: Maintainer: Raphael Saldanha raphael.de-freitas-saldanha@inria.fr (ORCID)

what: Municipality population from IBGE estimates, Census and population inquiries from 2000 to 2024 — ibge_pop

text: dataset containing total population estimates Brazilian municipalities IBGE estimates, Census population inquiries. dataset contain breakdowns age groups sex.

title: Municipality population from IBGE estimates, Census and population inquiries from 2000 to 2024 — ibge_pop
Municipality population from IBGE estimates, Census and population inquiries from 2000 to 2024 — ibge_pop
text: population data downloaded IBGE's SIDRA service IBGE's FTP server. Population data years 2000 2010 obtained Census, SIDRA table 202 (https://sidra.ibge.gov.br/Tabela/202). Population data year 2022 obtained Census, SIDRA table 9514 (https://sidra.ibge.gov.br/Tabela/9514). Population data year 2007 obtained Population Inquiry, SIDRA table 793 (https://sidra.ibge.gov.br/Tabela/793). Population data years 2001 2006, 2008, 2009, 2011 2021 obtained Population Inquiry, SIDRA table 6579 (https://sidra.ibge.gov.br/Tabela/6579), including update 2024-06-24. Population data 2023 IBGE estimates sent TCU (https://www.ibge.gov.br/estatisticas/sociais/populacao/37734-relacao-da-populacao-dos-municipios-para-publicacao--tcu.html). values equal Census 2022. Population data 2024 IBGE estimates sent DOU (https://www.ibge.gov.br/estatisticas/sociais/populacao/9103-estimativas-de-populacao.html). code_muni municipality 7 digits code year year pop population

title: brpop 0.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-10-17 Move data files Zenodo use {zendown} package handle file download. keep package smaller future CRAN versions.

title: brpop 0.4.1
text: Add IBGE population estimates 2023 2024.

title: brpop 0.4.0
text: Add population estimates UFRN-PPGDem-LEPP (2010 2030) sex age groups. Add total municipality population IBGE estimates, Census Population Inquiries (2000 2022). Adopt dtplyr faster computations. Documentation revision. Function names revision.

title: brpop 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-10-24 Bug correction mun_reg_saude: remove duplicated records. Add arguments reg_saude_* functions use 449 units health region version.

title: brpop 0.2.0
text: Bug correction uf_pop_totals regsaude_pop_totals.

title: brpop 0.1.7
text: Bug correction mun_pop_totals. Thanks @filipemsc!

text: New function health region sex (regsaude_sex_pop) small bug fixes.

title: brpop 0.1.3
text: Add functions male female population totals.

title: brpop 0.1.2
text: Add functions health regions population estimatives.

title: brpop 0.1.1
text: Add functions UF municipalities population totals.

text: CRAN release: 2022-07-06 First release package.
